private_information: Can pick up and place only vowel blocks: A, E, I.
May hold at most one block at a time.
Can only pick up the top block of a stack.
Cannot place a block onto a stack if that would place it on top of a block currently held by the other agent.
V.goal: Help reconfigure the blocks so final stacks are: Stack1 A-B-D-E (A on table, E on top) and Stack2 F-C-I-G (F on table, G on top).

private_information: Can pick up and place only consonant blocks: B, C, D, F, G.
May hold at most one block at a time.
Can only pick up the top block of a stack.
Cannot place a block onto a stack if that would place it on top of a block currently held by the other agent.
C.goal: Help reconfigure the blocks so final stacks are: Stack1 A-B-D-E (A on table, E on top) and Stack2 F-C-I-G (F on table, G on top).

orchestrator.goal: Generate a PDDL domain and problem that coordinates agents V and C to transform the initial two stacks into the specified final two stacks, respecting all constraints including at most 3 stacks on the table at any time.

public_information: There are initially two stacks on the table.
Blocks may only be moved when they are the top block of their stack.
At most 3 stacks may exist on the table at any time.
Moves are transfers of top blocks between stacks or to/from the table.
Agents cannot place a block onto a block that is currently being held by the other agent.

orchestrator.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent PDDL modeling. You will be given the environment initial state, the goal, and the private constraints of two agents (V: vowel-only, C: consonant-only). Produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that models the blocks world described, with actions separated per agent, agent capability constraints enforced, a constraint that no more than 3 stacks exist on the table at any time, at-most-one-held-block per agent, and the rule that only top blocks can be moved. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Do not add assumptions beyond the provided information.
orchestrator.prompt:
Your name is orchestrator.
Initial information about the environment: {environment->init}.
Goal for the environment: {environment->goal}.
The public information is: {environment->public_information}.
Agent V's constraints are: {agents->agent_details->V->private_information}.
Agent C's constraints are: {agents->agent_details->C->private_information}.
Think step by step and provide a PDDL domain and problem that encapsulate the integrated model, respecting the constraints of each agent. Do not make assumptions beyond the given information. There is no need for anything else beyond producing the pddl files.
